chunks.summary: After BitLocker encryption is complete, administrators can manage protection through three key options: Suspend protection (temporarily disables BitLocker while maintaining encryption, useful for Windows updates), Backup recovery key (saves the 48-digit recovery key to Azure AD, file, or print for emergency decryption), and Turn off BitLocker (fully decrypts the drive, requiring significant time to reverse all encryption changes). BitLocker PIN provides additional authentication security but requires Group Policy modification to enable, adding an extra protection layer beyond the standard recovery key mechanism.
